original: Larson, Carl Marcus, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 16/6/85 i Sthlm av Gustaf L. o. Emma Bratt. G. 22 m. Eugenia Kleman. — Teaterstud. f. Konstantin Axelsson. Började h. Ranft på Ös-termalmsteat. 05, v. Salmso^ns operett-sällsk. 06-07, åter h. Ranft (på Os-carsteat.) 07, med denne t. Stora teat. i Gbg, knuten t. denna teat. sed. 20. Därjämte eng. v. Brunnshusteat. i H:-fors somr. 05-14 samt v. Folkets parkers centralstyr. Bl. roller: Zuniga o. Dancairo i Carmen, Cajus i Muntra fruarna i Windsor, Crespel i Hoff-manns äventyr, Mazetto i Don Juan, Moruccio’ i Låglandet, Kungen i Det var en gång, Rocco i Lyckoflickan, Riassa i Farinelli, Prins Pietro i Boc-caccio, Lord Hamilton i Lady Hamil-lon m. fl. Medl. av Sv. teaterförb. o. TSO, sekr. i TSO 29-34. PatrGM 45.
translated: Larson, Carl Marcus, actor, Gothenburg, b. 16/6/85 in Stockholm to Gustaf L. and Emma Bratt. Married on 22nd with Eugenia Kleman. Theatre studies with Konstantin Axelsson. Started at Ranft at the Östermalm Theatre in 1905, with Salmson's operetta company from 1906-1907, returned to Ranft (at the Oscar Theatre) in 1907, and has been with Stora Theatre in Gothenburg since 1920. Also employed at the Brunnshus Theatre in Helsinki during summers from 1905-1914, and with the Central Board of People's Parks. Notable roles include Zuniga and Dancairo in Carmen, Cajus in The Merry Wives of Windsor, Crespel in Hoffmann's Adventure, Mazetto in Don Juan, Moruccio in The Lowland, the King in Once Upon a Time, Rocco in The Lucky Girl, Riassa in Farinelli, Prince Pietro in Boccaccio, Lord Hamilton in Lady Hamilton, among others. Member of the Swedish Theatre Association and the Swedish Actors' Union, secretary in the Swedish Actors' Union from 1929-1934. Died in 1945.

structured.name: Carl Marcus Larson
structured.description: Carl Marcus Larson was a Swedish actor known for his notable roles in various theaters.
